title: How many US Presidents were cigarette smokers? - Quora
tags: Specific Presidents of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Warren Harding Harding's drinking and smoking habits while he was in the White House were far more controversial. Harding used tobacco in all forms. He smoked two cigars a day, interspersed with a pipe and cigarettes. Harding also chewed, although he tapered off somewhat after entering the White House because of his wife's nagging. To many, chewing was a filthy habit, but not to Thomas Edison. Harding once shared a plug of tobacco with the famous inventor, causing Edison to remark, "Harding's all right. Any man who chews tobacco is all right." http://www.presidentprofiles.com/Grant-Eisenhower/Warren-G-Harding-Presidential-appointments-and-style.html Franklin Delano Roosevelt  Lyndon Baines Johnson His health had been affected by years of heavy smoking, poor diet, and extreme stress; the former president had advanced coronary artery disease. He had his first, nearly fatal, heart attack in July 1955 and suffered a second one in April 1972, but had been unable to quit smoking after he left the Oval Office in 1969.  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lyndon_B._Johnson Dwight Eisenhower  John Fitzgerald Kennedy  Barack Obamahttp://blogs.abcnews.com/politicalradar/2008/06/obama-admits-sm.html Other possible candidates (unverified):http://cigarettesreporter.com/presidents-smoke/

The cigarette is a relatively modern invention - thus: FDR, Ike (quit during), Kennedy (very rarely, but Jackie smoked), Johnson (quit long before Presidency, started again right after), Reagan (rarely, and hated it - had to use a ciggie during sponsored programming in the 40’s and 50’s), Bush II (had quit), Barack (lied about quitting)
